name: Typesense
desc: Deploy Typesense to create a fast, open-source search engine designed for instant and relevant results. Typesense is optimized for speed and ease of use, making it ideal for applications that require search functionality.
longDesc:
Typesense is a modern, open-source search engine that focuses on delivering an easy-to-use API for creating powerful search experiences. It is designed to provide relevant search results quickly, with a strong emphasis on performance and developer-friendliness.

**Key Features:**
- **One-Click Deployment:** Easily set up Typesense using Docker or other containerization methods for straightforward installation.
- **Scalability:** Capable of handling large datasets and high query volumes, making it suitable for applications ranging from small websites to large enterprise platforms.
- **Privacy and Security:** Operates locally or on private servers, ensuring that data remains secure and user privacy is protected.
- **API Compatibility:** Offers a simple RESTful API that allows easy integration into various applications and services.
- **Faceted Search:** Supports advanced features like faceted search, typo tolerance, and synonyms, enhancing user search experiences.
useCases:
- **Developers:** Integrate Typesense into web applications to provide fast and relevant search results, improving user experience.
- **E-commerce Platforms:** Use Typesense to power product search and filtering features, enabling customers to find products quickly.
- **Content Management Systems:** Implement Typesense to enhance search functionality in blogs, documentation sites, or knowledge bases.
support:
- **Community Forums:** Engage with the Typesense community for support and discussions through the [Typesense GitHub Repository](https://github.com/typesense/typesense).
- **Documentation:** Comprehensive guides and user manuals are available at the [Typesense Documentation](https://typesense.org/docs/) for detailed reference on setup and usage.
- **Troubleshooting Help:** Access the issues section on GitHub to report bugs and find community-contributed solutions.

This template provides an overview of Typesenseâ€™s functionalities and practical applications, emphasizing its role in creating efficient search experiences. For more detailed information, visit the [official Typesense website](https://typesense.org).

options.name: apiKeyFile
options.desc: Sets the admin api key for typesense. Always use this option instead of settings.server.api-key to prevent the key from being written to the world-readable nix store.

options.name: settings
options.desc: Typesense configuration. Refer to the documentation for supported values.
options.type: attribute set of section of an INI file (attrs of INI atom (null, bool, int, float or string) or a non-empty list of them)

options.name: settings.server.api-address
options.desc: Address to which Typesense API service binds.

options.name: settings.server.api-port
options.desc: Port on which the Typesense API service listens.
options.type: 16 bit unsigned integer; between 0 and 65535 (both inclusive)

options.name: settings.server.data-dir
options.desc: Path to the directory where data will be stored on disk.
